Package commandbased

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • commandbased.Scheduler
  • public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    Jul 8, 2018 The scheduler is extremely error-safe. Any individual command that throws an exception or invalid method call should not stop the other components from running. Therefore errors are frequently just printed rather than thrown. To force better practices upon the students this style could be reversed.
    Author:
    Finn Frankis

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(Command c)
      Starts a new command running, stopping any commands that it would conflict with
      static Scheduler getInstance()  
      void interrupt​(Command c, Command cause)
      Stops a command from running (interrupt), restarting all default commands from subsystems used that don't conflict with the interruption
      boolean isRunning​(Command c)
      Checks if a command is running
      void remove​(Command c)
      Stops a command from running (no interrupt), restarting all default commands from subsystems used
      void run()
      Executes each command currently running once, then removes them if they have finished.
      static boolean sharedSubsystem​(Command c, Command o)
      Checks if two commands both use any one of the same subsystem and therefore would conflict

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Scheduler getInstance()
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the scheduler

      • add

        public void add​(Command c)
        Starts a new command running, stopping any commands that it would conflict with
        Parameters:
        c - the command to run

      • remove

        public void remove​(Command c)
        Stops a command from running (no interrupt), restarting all default commands from subsystems used
        Parameters:
        c - the command to stop

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt​(Command c,
                      Command cause)
        Stops a command from running (interrupt), restarting all default commands from subsystems used that don't conflict with the interruption
        Parameters:
        c - the command to stop

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning​(Command c)
        Checks if a command is running
        Parameters:
        c - the command to check
        Returns:
        whether that command is contained in the set of running commands

      • run

        public void run()
        Executes each command currently running once, then removes them if they have finished. A single subsystem will never be executed more than once in a call of run

      • sharedSubsystem

        public static boolean sharedSubsystem​(Command c,
                                      Command o)
        Checks if two commands both use any one of the same subsystem and therefore would conflict
        Parameters:
        c - the first command
        o - the second command
        Returns:
        whether they have any shared subsystems
